metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3563 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description: A vulnerability classified as problematic has been found in Linux Kernel. Affected is the function read_50_controller_cap_complete of the file tools/mgmt-tester.c of the component BlueZ. The manipulation of the argument cap_len leads to null pointer dereference. It is recommended to apply a patch to fix this issue. VDB-211086 is the identifier assigned to this vulnerability.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> introduced in 5.56 This flaw is only in the mgmt-tester tool in the bluez-tests package in universe, this isn't normally used

criterions.comment: bluez package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
